title: Banned two weeks for quoting someone
body:
Because “I should know better” than to say something another user said straight back to them.

The best part? The other users comment wasn’t even removed, even though it said the same thing that supposedly got me a two week ban.

Either the moderator who removed my post messed up, or the moderators aren’t trained appropriately. If they can’t look and see that I flat out quoted the other user in the response.... What I think really happened is that they didn’t like that I kept pointing out their failures, so they used this as an excuse to ban me for two weeks. Funny how they’re still “talking about” removing voting months later. Seems more like they aren’t talking - it doesn’t take this long to make a decision that is obviously correct and implement it.

Oh, and due to the issues, I can’t even go back to see the removal message or grab the link to it. I know this isn’t the moderators fault it just makes it much harder to expose this horrible action.

replies.body:
This is simply not true.  Your removal was for quoting someone calling you an idiot and calling them an idiot back.  That falls under the Golden Rule as well as the rules regarding Facilitate Civil Discussion.  Normally a removal like this would be minimal, but given your very high removal count as well as several bans for similar behavior, it's pretty clear that you are not planning on changing your behavior.  The two week ban is your final warning to start being more respectful and civil towards others.

The comment you replied to _**was**_ removed as well so do not spread false information regarding this.  This is the thread in question for reference -- https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-discussion/YOaGfhPK.

It was not removed when I checked immediately following my removal, so unless caching was an issue (which I don’t see on the boards), then it wasn’t at the same time.

If you seriously think quoting “idiot” back to someone deserves a 2 week ban, that’s absurd. If it was out of nowhere, maybe. But there wasn’t any other recent removals, nor should this one post deserve a final warning.

Feel free to post my entire history to try and prove that this is right - but the word “idiot” **quoted back to someone** doesn’t deserve 2 weeks and a final warning ever, period, on its own.

You literally said to him

>That literally is not predictive of a loss at all.

>You're an idiot.

So stop saying "I only quoted him"

He said “You’re an idiot”.

I said that back. That is quoting him, even if it is not delineated as such.

Did you say the exact same thing he said back, or did you quote him?
Because those are mutually exclusive. One is meta-language, one is plain language.

It's the same difference as between a table and the word "table".

Quoting does not have to be delineated with quotation marks to be quoting.

The word "quote" as a definition is defined as "to repeat the exact words of a person" - which I did. I copied the same words the other user used.

Point being it's not mutually exclusive - both are defined as quote in the English language, regardless of what you think the definition of the word "quote" is. Furthermore, that has no bearing on whether repeating what someone said should result in a 2 week escalation and a snarky comment from a moderator (it shouldn't).

Fair enough. I was unaware that even simple repetition can be considered a quote. But then you're whole point about being banned for quoting someone is an attempt to hide behind semantic technicality.

Me saying
>You're an idiot

would get me in trouble, even though you have used those words, too.

Me saying
> You were banned for saying "You're an idiot".

wouldn't.

It's obvious your title is an attempt to make it seem like you were banned for something like the latter, when it's equally obvious you were punished for the former.

Call it quoting if you will. But just because you repeated something somebody else has said doesn't mean those words are somehow exempt from the rules.

Saying something back to someone should not result in an instant 2 week ban with no **recent** infractions. I won't deny that I've had prior infractions - for much more severe things. This is like throwing someone in jail for a year for a speeding ticket simply because they had a DWI a year ago.

I am not arguing that it didn't merit deletion - it likely did, and I accept that it was technically out of line. It did not merit the punishment issued, and it is clear from the message (in which the deleting moderator gave me a snarky "you should know better" and "this is your final warning" beyond the normal message) that it was done out of spite to me and/or as an excuse to get rid of me for two weeks.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=M8WEELZA,comment-id=00010000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2020-02-17T20:42:07.535+0000)Saying something back to someone should not result in an instant 2 week ban with no **recent** infractions.

* You had 3 removals on 1/21/2020
* You had 1 removal on 1/16/2020
* You had 2 removals on 1/13/2020
* You had 5 removals on 1/10/2020
* You had 2 removals on 12/11/2019
* You had 1 removals on 11/30/2019

This is 14 removals in less than three months after your 3-day ban on 11/28/2019. Looking over it, I see at least two things I would have escalated your punishment for *before* the removal in question.

If anything, moderation has been *overly lenient* with your account. Many of these were warnings or simple deletion messages when the moderators could have been significantly harsher.

14 **minor** removals. Furthermore, you should not consider multiple removals as part of one comment chain separately - this is the statistical fallacy where you are attempting to use sheer number against me instead of looking at the actual cases.

Many of those removals were **extremely** minor - they were not rising to the point of an escalation. If you seriously would've considered escalating from a 3 day directly to a 2 week ban for any of those, that is a failure of your part to apply rules sensibly.

Simply "could have been harsher" is not an excuse for an improper escalation for a minor thing. If the old actions should've been harsher, that is not an excuse to apply a 14 day ban (an escalation of 5 times the punishment) for this minor instance. You are again attempting to use past errors on the moderators part to justify this error.

It's clear you're looking for a reason to get rid of me because you don't like me because I call you out for this sort of thing. It's also clear from me looking at the past two weeks of posts now that I've actually opened the boards back up that I'm not the only person with this issue.

Have you considered part of the reason the boards changes weren't run by you and Riot isn't paying attention to you is that the Rioters (including Bazerka, who frequents the boards) see the piss poor moderation of the boards and have decided to just let them go to shit until they're finally removed? There are problems with the moderation team and I attempt to point them out and am always met with "we know best" instead of you considering what myself and **MANY** others are saying. Then you try to silence us with these fallacious arguments - I guarantee you others are seeing this too.

This is quite frankly turning into a combination of Animal Farm and Fahrenheit 451 - and I guarantee you other boards users and Rioters are seeing this too. You'll probably "escalate" me again because this comment is "too bad for the boards" or "too insulting" - well, when you use blatantly fallacious arguments here then what do you expect? Your tenure seems to be on its last legs - especially given that Riot hasn't fixed the boards in a week - so why not go out with a bang and just ban everyone you disagree with before Riot revamps the boards and gives some new people who actually care and are mature about their responsibilities the job?

****
Feel free to post every single one of those deletion messages in its entirety (since I can't access them to do so myself) and let the community judge whether they should've been escalated. I doubt you'll do this because you know that many of them will be seen as improper and/or too severe for the comments.

Additionally, have you considered why users such as myself are having this "burnout" for lack of a better term? Why do you seem to always see these long term users and even moderators go from being great contributors to this "insulting" person that you dislike? Maybe part of it is your lack of effort in enforcing gameplay rules - and/or enforcing healthy boards software (voting).

Lastly, I'll point out that a certain user (GatekeeperTDS) is exceedingly more insulting than I am in many many many of his posts - yet you are threatening me with a ban and he is still doing this even on this thread. If that isn't evidence enough of a conspiracy against me, I don't know what would be.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=M8WEELZA,comment-id=0001000000000000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2020-02-17T21:51:43.845+0000)If you seriously would've considered escalating from a 3 day directly to a 2 week ban for any of those, that is a failure of your part to apply rules sensibly.

I'll simply show a few of the problem pieces. I did specify removals (which are different from specific warnings), but these were the biggest issues given your rather large number of removals:

>"Please stop talking out your ass."
>
>**"Do you blame rape victims for the actions of others? They could’ve just not gone to that nightclub, or chosen not to participate in drinking?"**
>
>"Dude, you're actually dense."
>
>"I recommend Disney+ - I think Hannah Montana is on that, so you can get the "best of both worlds" without making others adapt to your own desires."

The one in bold I would have straight-up 7 or 14-day banned you for, as it's dragging in social issues and extremely nasty ones at that. The boards are not a place for that sort of parallel.

> It's clear you're looking for a reason to get rid of me because you don't like me because I call you out for this sort of thing.

If this were true, I would have banned you long ago, because there are 3 pages of removals on your account and a number of them were not punished as strictly as they could have been. You'll notice I have not.

>Have you considered part of the reason the boards changes weren't run by you and Riot isn't paying attention to you is that the Rioters (including Bazerka, who frequents the boards) see the piss poor moderation of the boards and have decided to just let them go to shit until they're finally removed? 

I've considered it, and then dismissed it because A: this has been an ongoing issue long before board moderation came about, B: we've been reviewed several times by our Riot contacts and they haven't mentioned any concerns with moderation from them *or* from others at Riot aside from a few situations we have addressed, and C: I frankly know more about the relationship between Riot and moderation than you do.

>So why not go out with a bang and just ban everyone you disagree with before Riot revamps the boards and gives some new people who actually care and are mature about their responsibilities the job?

Because you seem to assign me with a malevolent desire to punish others that I do not, in fact, possess. We disagree on several things and some of them are things you are extremely passionate about, but that does not, in fact, make me some sort of enemy of the community.

>You'll probably "escalate" me again because this comment is "too bad for the boards" or "too insulting"...

If I haven't for some of your previous posts to me, I wouldn't for this one.

Did you look at the context for any of those removals? Because the social issue was not dragged in at all - it was used as a metaphor for the victim blaming going on in the thread.

Furthermore, if you think blaming rape victims is a "social issue" that's... absolutely unacceptable as much as thinking slavery is a "social issue".

You also bring up the "Hannah Montana" comment - which if you don't remember you admitted was a misinterpretation by the moderator who removed it because they didn't recognize the reference that a vast majority of boards users would have (given the common age of League users). You admitted yourself that was borderline and likely shouldn't have been actioned given the explanation - yet you're trying to use it against me here?

TLDR: the use of the word "ass" (if I had said "Please stop lying" would that have been different? Being crass is not against the rules) and the use of the word "dense" - both of which are completely valid discussion points to make in a discussion - is what led to this?

Even more absurd now that you've explained this. None of those comments should've been escalated - you are grasping at straws to justify this improper escalation. And once again **if those comments should've resulted in a ban, that does not justify the application of a 5x escalated ban for a comment that did not deserve punishment to start. One moderation error does not justify making another one to "rectify" it**.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=M8WEELZA,comment-id=000100000000000000010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2020-02-17T22:18:33.204+0000)Did you look at the context for any of those removals? 

I did, yes.

> Furthermore, if you think blaming rape victims is a "social issue" that's... absolutely unacceptable as much as thinking slavery is a "social issue"

Discussion of sexual assault or slavery would both fall into the "social issues / politics" general category of things that are absolutely not okay on the boards, even if relavant to a conversation. Asking "do you think sexual assault is okay then?" or "do you think slavery is okay then?" are both good examples of things we would *definitely* not allow.

>None of those comments should've been escalated - you are grasping at straws to justify this improper escalation.

You are free to disagree with the ruling, but you are not entitled to get the result you seek. If you'd like to escalate further, you are always free to send in a ticket to Player Support, where it will likely end up with Keyru, our primary Riot contact.

That's the last avenue available to you if you wish to contest an action take on your account.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=M8WEELZA,comment-id=00010000000000000001000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2020-02-17T22:27:06.885+0000)You didn't look at the context, because you simply see "ZOMG social issue inappropriate".

Perhaps I should be more blunt -- there is *no* context in which that is an acceptable topic of conversation for the boards. Use other metaphors.

> I would love to have Keyru respond to me - but I've had people tell me privately that they have submitted tickets to Keyru (first ticket they submit re: boards issues, by the way) that go unanswered for **over a month**. Maybe I should do that and expose it on twitter/reddit?

Your call. I have no control over how busy Keyru is or what other responsibilities she has.

> Why are you unwilling to ask Keyru to come defend you here - given that you claim to have good contact with Keyru? It should be trivial to have her confirm you're correct and come discuss with me here - why are you wanting to shove this to private communication?

Because I know how Keyru prefers to handle this sort of thing, and do not, in fact, have the power to force her to handle it differently. I have, in the past, suggested that she engage on threads, and she has declined to do so in almost all of those cases. I can't speak for why (as I am not her) -- all I can do is tell you the process you would need to follow to escalate things beyond the Herald team.

> By the way, Keyru hasn't posted on the boards in months - for the "primary Riot contact" for the boards, that's kinda pitiful, don't you think?

I don't really have an opinion on this. I'm aware that her role has other responsibilities as well, and I would not presume to guess as to what those are or how much she feels personally being on the boards actively posting is important to her role.

This is exactly my point. You didn't look at the context, because you simply see "ZOMG social issue inappropriate". That is not what the boards rules are for, and that is not why there are human moderators. Human moderators exist to apply common sense and sensibility to their actions, not simply see "welp it violates the rule so..."

I would love to have Keyru respond to me - but I've had people tell me privately that they have submitted tickets to Keyru (first ticket they submit re: boards issues, by the way) that go unanswered for **over a month**. Maybe I should do that and expose it on twitter/reddit?

Why are you unwilling to ask Keyru to come defend you here - given that you claim to have good contact with Keyru? It should be trivial to have her confirm you're correct and come discuss with me here - why are you wanting to shove this to private communication?

By the way, Keyru hasn't posted on the boards in months - for the "primary Riot contact" for the boards, that's kinda pitiful, don't you think?

You have nailed it so perfectly. Extremely good arguments and examples. Alas, the moderators have 0 judicial knowledge or the ability to judge offences propely. They do so from the standpoint of a normal person, not a lawyer. Not to mention they have a tendency to defend snowflakes but not punish people who insult persons in the "black list"
I, myself, have been insulted, my professional abilities have been challenged and insulted by non-proffessionals.  Yet my posts get removed rather quickly, while their's stay.
Hopefully this sad place will be shut down. The reasonable people get drowned and insulted and Riot doesn't care about this place.
“You’re an idiot”.

Quoting back to someone is the same as calling them it.  I see no difference.  For a much more extreme example, if someone calls you a racial slur and you call them it back, you are both guilty of using a zero tolerance phrase no matter who started it.  You did not need to call him an idiot -- that was your choice, a choice I bluntly will say you frequently make.  Such behavior is not permitted on the Boards.  Had this been a first, second, third, or even fourth offense, no action would have been taken.  However, you had 57 removals and 4 bans prior to this in just about a 15 month time period for similar type behavior and thus this action continued on the ban escalation process.

If you do not know the difference between those 2 I simply do not have anything polite to say to you. If someone says X to me and I respond with " How dare you call me X? How have I deserved this? You are just being rude" then that repetition of X can in no way be punishable. If you think otherwise then you have no business judging the people here. You will only baffle them and cause them misery with your poor and incorrect judgement. Maybe if I quote a poem which has an insult to convey a message.( The insult is not the message, just 1 of many words) maybe according to you I must be banned. Who gives a damn about freedom of speech, eh? Let's just remove everything so the snowflakes are not offended. Absurd.

That is not accurate at all.

The response literally says:

> That literally is not predictive of a loss at all.
> 
> You're an idiot.

He did not say "How dare you call me an idiot!" or anything like that; he knowingly responded by calling the user an idiot directly.  Again, no action would have been taken if the user did not have an extensive history of repeat behavior.

> [{quoted}](name=TeodorusofNoxus,realm=EUNE,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=M8WEELZA,comment-id=0001000000010001,timestamp=2020-02-19T10:47:42.296+0000)
>
> " How dare you call me X? How have I deserved this? You are just being rude" then that repetition of X can in no way be punishable.
>[…]
>Maybe if I quote a poem which has an insult to convey a message.

One of the other posts in this thread clarifies that it wasn't this kind of quote. The other poster said "You're an idiot", and rujitra said the exact same thing back. It may have been a repetition, but it's clear within context that the repeated insult was directed specifically at the poster, and not just quoted for reference.

Again, just like The Djinn, you're using sheer number and refusing to actually investigate. From 14 "recent removals", The Djinn attempted to pull out anything wrong - and he only found four total - two of which are obviously incorrect, one of which he himself admitted was incorrect, and the other one he is grossly misinterpreting.

Maybe you should actually go look at the fact that I have been treated like shit for all of these. I've tried to contest things and I've been met with "we're the mods, we make the rules" - even though the posts are much less than things other people have done **even on the same threads**. Others get away with so much compared to me - and the only valid assumption is that I have a skull and bones above my head saying "punish this guy".

You may not see a difference but there is very obviously a difference. The rules are intended to protect discussions from being derailed - my comment was not the one that derailed the discussion, the other players' is. If that player cannot take being called an idiot, they should not have called me an idiot. Again, I agree with my comment being removed - but a 2 week ban is not appropriate when it was a response to a comment that I myself didn't even think to report. Sure, a "strict" reading of the rules says this is okay - but the entire reason human moderators are a thing is to apply common sense - which is that replying to someone quoting what they say is a valid discussion tactic and not banworthy.

Was the original thing that was said itself an infraction worthy of such a heavy punishment? Were you quoting it back at the person who first said it merely so that your reply would have context, or in an attempt to throw their words back at them?

That said, moderation is so broken that it's basically gaslighting and I'm surprised anyone's still here.

No, it was not worthy of a two week ban, and on its own it likely merited deletion but absolutely not a punishment.

It was not even an attempt to throw their words back at them - it was showing them how them saying it means nothing because anyone can say it to anyone and it doesn’t suddenly make their argument invalid.

Again, I can’t access any of this due to the fact moderation messages are broken (again, not mods fault). I guarantee the primary reason was because one of the heralds (I do remember it was one of the heralds) saw it and jumped on the opportunity to issue a punishment that **if nobody cared to investigate** would “look legit” to me, because he was tired of me pointing out the failures of the current heralds.

Maybe if they spent all this time they spend making excuses actually making changes the boards wouldn’t be shit. When’s the last time they brought on new mods, or put a call out to the community for applications?

I mean, how do you know which post prompted the punishment in the first place? Since mod messages are broken, you'd have to track all your recent posts and spot the deleted one (and if there was more than one, good luck guessing which one it was). At the very least, you should be able to look in your browser history for the thread you believe contained the deleted post that prompted the punishment, and tell us what the content was. Unless you would rather not do so in the first place, which I'd understand, as it's obviously not smart to repost punishable content. However, mods tend to be more forgiving when it's reposted in the context of asking for an explanation of why it wasn't okay; that's one of the purposes of Discuss The Boards, after all.

Yeah, the inability to see any mod explanation for stuff like this is absolutely problematic. That Boards feature is broken.

The mods and heralds can't make changes to the actual Boards themselves because none of them are devs with authority, and this platform's software basically launched as abandonware. It was unsupported and obsolete on day one. And bringing on new mods would probably be somewhere between useless and harmful, but possibly dipping into very beneficial. More mods can only do what current mods can do, which is shadowmoderate (undertake moderation actions without affecting users knowing it's happened, until they faceplant into a suspension) or simply not moderate. I still haven't gotten a straight answer on whether the ones who'd rather go on furlough are actually stepping back or still processing the report queue and simply dismissing almost everything due to not wanting to shadowmod even though a different mod might've actioned it anyway.

Moderation is _broken_. **_Broken_**. I dunno if you saw my [meme about it](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/sUtAlA4h-video-footage-of-riot-introducing-mods-to-boards-new-layout), but it's actually a good description of what happened. They cannot work because the boss took away their tools. It's a miracle any of them are even still here. It's a wonder any of us are still here. It's like a company that's just experienced massive "synergy" and almost everyone who could get things done has been laid off so the remaining employees are up a creek without a paddle and customers are like "uhhhh hello" and synergy survivors gotta be like "no, we're fukt and so are you but not in the good way" and you cross your arms while you wait and see WTF happens now.

TL;DR: Moderation is broken and mods are between a rock and a hard place, and thus so are we.
Moderation is broken, but it's been a goddamn peaceful two weeks without rujitra crying about moderator corruption every day. The ban should have been permanent.
